items.title: python2.7 __future__ annotations problem
items.body:
In python 2.7 it will check annotations import, but in python2.7 try to import annotations from __future__ it will report 
`from __future__ import annotations`
`SyntaxError: future feature annotations is not defined (<input>, line 1)`
Is there a way to solve this problem by flake8 setting not by ignoring it?
Also found a error code problem in https://pypi.org/project/flake8-future-import/  the annotations's code should be FI18, in the page it is FI12.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15188761/63159413-1a231680-c04e-11e9-9ea1-cad30d18a0b6.png)

items.title: pip 10 test failure
items.body:
Testing fails with pip 10 because it depends on pip internals:
```
======================================================================
ERROR: setUpClass (test_flake8_future_import.Flake8TestCase)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/build/source/test_flake8_future_import.py", line 245, in setUpClass
    for dist in pip.utils.get_installed_distributions():
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'utils'

----------------------------------------------------------------------
```
In pip 10 functions like these are internal, that is, `pip._internals.get_installed_distributions`.

items.title: Multiple-letter violation codes are not displayed by Vim Syntastic syntax checker
items.body:
**This is not a bug with your plugin** but I'm raising this here for your awareness, since you use multiple-letter violation code(s).

I've filed an issue with `vim-syntastic`: https://github.com/vim-syntastic/syntastic/issues/2163.

The resolution of that bug may be of interest to you.  If not, please disregard this report, with my apologies.

Note, this may be related to issue #5.

items.title: Files missing in pypi 0.4.4 tarball
items.body:
The `LICENSE` file available in the Git repository is missing in the 0.4.4 tarball currently available on https://pypi.python.org/pypi/flake8-future-import/0.4.4 despite being older than that release. Please have it added to future tarballs.

Similarly, `test_flake8_future_import.py` is missing in the pypi tarball, so that `setup.py test` fails.

Found during packaging review for openSUSE.

items.title: No support for flake8 3.0
items.body:
I just tried using this with flake8 3.0.0b1 and got:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.5/runpy.py", line 170, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.5/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/__main__.py", line 4, in <module>
    cli.main()
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/cli.py", line 16, in main
    app.run(argv)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 292, in run
    self._run(argv)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 278, in _run
    self.initialize(argv)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 269, in initialize
    self.register_plugin_options()
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/main/application.py", line 149, in register_plugin_options
    self.check_plugins.register_options(self.option_manager)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/plugins/manager.py", line 378, in register_options
    list(self.manager.map(call_register_options))
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/plugins/manager.py", line 252, in map
    yield func(self.plugins[name], *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/plugins/manager.py", line 348, in generated_function
    return method(optmanager, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8/plugins/manager.py", line 198, in register_options
    add_options(optmanager)
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8_future_import.py", line 60, in add_options
    cls.add_arguments(Wrapper())
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8_future_import.py", line 102, in add_arguments
    help='Do only apply to files which not only have '
  File "/home/florian/proj/qutebrowser/git/.tox/flake8/lib/python3.5/site-packages/flake8_future_import.py", line 57, in add_argument
    parser.config_options.append(opt.lstrip('-'))
AttributeError: 'OptionManager' object has no attribute 'config_options'
```

flake8 documentation about the change: http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/plugin-development/cross-compatibility.html#option-handling-on-flake8-2-and-3

Related fixes in pep8-naming:

https://github.com/PyCQA/pep8-naming/commit/b4c3ebd4884bac27fae56aa45c6f9e7c5b5ea5a0
https://github.com/PyCQA/pep8-naming/commit/dd623fcd76db58922a511578ff5d14ce741f9636

items.title: with_statement not deactivated by min-version = 2.6
items.body:
`with_statement` is mandatory in Python 2.6, but setting `min-version = 2.6` does not allow `with_statement` to be omitted.

See https://gerrit.wikimedia.org/r/#/c/291729/ 

It looks like https://github.com/xZise/flake8-future-import/blob/master/flake8_future_import.py#L131 should be using `feature.mandatory <= self.min_version`.

items.title: Bad syntax tests
items.body:
The Python repo has some lovely bad syntax test cases in `Lib/test/badsyntax_future*` https://hg.python.org/cpython/file/tip/Lib/test

This plugin raises ValueError exceptions for many of them, which dont turn out very pretty in flake8, as it doesnt show the error at all. e.g.

```
$ flake8 Lib/test/badsyntax_future3.py 
Process Process-1:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/reporter.py", line 74, in process_main
    self._process_main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/reporter.py", line 50, in _process_main
    self.input_file(filename)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/engine.py", line 95, in input_file
```

The lack of good output for these files could be blamed on flake8/pep8.  maybe they should catch these exceptions and explain the failure better to the end-user.

Some at least you may find are interesting enough to be new error codes.

Anyway, it looks like only file '10' is showing an error correctly; here is the full output

```
$ flake8 Lib/test/badsyntax_future*.py 
Process Process-3:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/reporter.py", line 74, in process_main
    self._process_main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/reporter.py", line 50, in _process_main
    self.input_file(filename)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/engine.py", line 95, in input_file
    return fchecker.check_all(expected=expected, line_offset=line_offset)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pep8-1.6.3a0-py2.7.egg/pep8.py", line 1571, in check_all
    self.check_ast()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pep8-1.6.3a0-py2.7.egg/pep8.py", line 1518, in check_ast
    for lineno, offset, text, check in checker.run():
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8_future_import.py", line 106, in run
    yield self._generate_error(alias.name, import_node.lineno, True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8_future_import.py", line 90, in _generate_error
    code = 10 + self.AVAILABLE_IMPORTS.index(future_import)
ValueError: tuple.index(x): x not in tuple

    self.run()

  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/reporter.py", line 74, in process_main
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
```
